Sequence Information.Peptide Name: TetraF2W-RK (WW291; Synthetic AMPs, Trp-rich; XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature:
Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is poorly similar (77.78%) toparent TetraF2W. W: 50%.Chemical modification:  C-terminal amidation.Activity: Active against E. coli K12 or ATCC 25922 (MIC 6.2-25 uM), K. pneumoniae 
ATCC 13883 (MIC 12.5 uM), S. epidermidis 1457 (MIC 6.2 uM), B. subtilis 168 (MIC 6.2 uM), and S. aureus USA300 (MIC 3.1 uM; MBC 12.5 uM). Also active against C. albicans (MIC 12.5 uM), C. glabrata (MIC 12.5 uM), and C. tropicalis (MIC 3.1-6.2 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: pH-insensitive (6.8-8); NaCl-insensitive:S. aureus (150 mM), serum-sensitive (5%).Toxicity:  human RBC HC50 30 uM.Structure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Literature Information.Author: Mishra B, Lushnikova T, Golla RM, Wang X, Wang G.2017
Literature Information.Title: Design and surface immobilization of short anti-biofilm peptides.
